Key Arguments: The bill gives too much power to politicians and powerbrokers to censor and control public discourse.
There is distrust in the authorities' ability to fairly determine what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
The bill is seen as an infringement on personal freedoms and autonomy.
Main Themes: Concerns about censorship and freedom of speech
Notable Quotes: The last thing we want is more power given to corrupt politicians and powerbrokers to censor and dictate to us and to decide what we can say, feel, think or do.
Get out of our lives you freaking maniacs and take the monsters from the U.N, WEF and their cohorts and collaborators with you, to prison preferably.
